name: Hotel de Blauvac

reviews.title: Hotel is Okay, but the location is great.
reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2004 and found the place to be decent, but the rooms were very hot and quite small. The bed wasn't very comfortable and it was noisy at night. The good part is that the hotel is right near the Place d'Horloge. Decent, but there were better establishments in the the area.

reviews.title: little rooms fit little people
reviews.text: Blauvac is a charming hotel, ans it is not very expansive.

reviews.title: so noisy we couldn't sleep
reviews.text: However, don't make a reservation for a standard room at any cost, they are just terrible ! so little, you can hardly move without bumping into something !

reviews.title: Fantastic value
reviews.text: the big rooms are a lot better.

reviews.title: Lovely small hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was pleasant enough, certainly a lot of character and good value. Friendly, helpful staff too. BUT...it was so noisy (with the windows closed and curtains drawn) outside in the narrow street that we were woken several times every night. The revellers party on until the early hours, singing their way home and then the refuse/tradesmen seem to start VERY early in the morning...in other words, very little consideration shown by locals for those on holiday. We stayed at Blauvac for the first two nights of our holiday, hoping it would be less raucous the second night but it was no better, and consequently we were shattered for the rest of the week. The room was comfortable, if a little on the cramped side. The spiral staircase was a little precarious, as I had read, but the upstairs room was useful whilst we were both tossing and turning! Breakfast was fine, a typical French breakfast! If a peaceful nights sleep matters to you, DON'T stay here.

We stayed here a couple of weeks ago and the hotel itself was very nice and the room was excellent but there is a club or bar located down the street and after 12 a.m. the people started to yell and sing and generally make a HUGE racket outside as they walked to and from the bar. The hotel is located down a very narrow street and the screaming echos through the alley and makes it sound 10 times louder! If it had not started to rain at 3 a.m. I don't know when the noise would have stopped. If you want a hotel that is in an excellent location for visiting the Pope's Palace, shopping and not too far to walk from the train station then this is the perfect place and a decent price - nice bathrooms and our room was very spacious. I would also like to mention that we were there on a week-end (Friday night) and that it may be a quieter place during the week!!
reviews.title: Noisy but nice!

reviews.text: We stayed here in March 2004. There were 4 of us, so we were in a large room. It had a double bed down stairs and a loft with 2 twin beds. It was so spacious and really nice. We stayed for 2 nights and have nothing but praises for this hotel and the price! I would not hesitate to return.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: This was probably our least favorite hotel of our trip to France. The room was ok although the nightstand lamps were both broken. The owner, Veronica, was pleasant although I'm not convinced that she did not know how to access the operator for a collect call to our credit company (as a result we were charged a hefty fee for our attempts at a collect phone call.) Our biggest problem that night was the noisiness of the alley our hotel room faced and guests running up and down the stairs and yelling down the stairs all night until 4 am.
reviews.title: Noisy hotel
We'd go back in a heartbeat
reviews.text: This was a great place for our first stop in the south of France(our first trip there as well). Our room was spacious and the bathroom was as well. The staff spoke english and was immensely helpful. I'd skip breakfast. Others have written about the noise. It's true you do hear street noises if you have your windows open. We had originally thought about staying closer to the palais du papes and were glad we did not. It would have been much more of a scene. The price is right. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

reviews.title: What a gem
reviews.text: My husband and I fell in love with this place. We went in Oct, so we didn't have any heat issues to deal with (rooms aren't air-conditioned), and we reserved the superior room (which was about 5 Euros or so more, so why not) and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the place. The bldg was originally a 17th century mansion and it shows. Great little details. Nice bathroom and room decor. And the location is great. Less than two minutes from the Place d'Horloge and the Palais du Papes. Avignon is a wonderful little town with great history. The hotel definitely helped us appreciate the splendor and age of the town.

description: The charming Hôtel de Blauvac is ideally located in the very centre of Avignon’s historical centre, inside the fortified walls, near the Place de l'Horloge and the Palais des Papes
